question:
Consider the following problem:

\[\begin{array}{ll}	
\text{Maximize} & Z= 5x_{1}+4x_{2}-x_{3}+3x_{4}\\
\text{subject to} & 3x_{1}+2x_{2}-3x_{3}+x_{4}\leq 24 \text{ (resource 1)}\\
& 3x_{1}+3x_{2}+x_{3}+3x_{4}\leq 36 \text{ (resource 2)}\\
& x_{1}, x_{2}, x_{3}, x_{4}\geq 0\\ 
\end{array}
\]

Choose the right answer to identify the Allowable range for the unit profit of $x_{1}$ to keep optimal solution:

A consulting firm will carry out two types of projects ($A$ and $B$). The development cost per project $A$ and $B$ is, respectively, $1$ and $2$ monetary units. The requirements in terms of analysts, programmers and terminals for each type of project, are indicated in the following table:

\[
\begin{array}{|c|c|c|c|}
\hline
\text{Project} & \text{N. of programmers}  & \text{N. of analysts}  & \text{N. of terminals} \\
\hline
\text{A} & 2 & 2 & 3 \\
\text{B} & 3 & 6 & 1 \\
\hline
\end{array}
\]

The company wants to minimize the cost of developing projects in the next period. In the development of these projects, at least $10$ programmers and $5$ analysts should be used while the company only has $6$ terminals available. In this situation, what are the decision variables to formalize the Linear Programming (LP) model that allows planning the company's activity?
answer1: $x_{i}$ is the number of developed project $i$ ($i=1$, for project $A$ and $i=2$, for project $B$)
answer2: $x_{2}$ is the number of developed projects $B$
answer3: $x_{1}$ is the number of developed projects $A$
answer4: $x$ is the number of developed projects $A$ and $B$

$$\begin{cases}
&x &+ &y &+ &z &= &0 \\
&-x &+ &3y &+ &2z &= &-1 \\
&2x &+ &y &- &z &= &0
\end{cases}$$
answer3: The system has infinitely many solutions depending on one parameter.
answer4: The system has infinitely many solutions depending on two parameters.

question:
Find the solutions of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
2x & + & y & - & 4z & = & 0 \\
-x & + & y & + & z & = & 0 \\
x & + & 5y & - & 5z & = & 0
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The solutions of the system are $\left(\frac{5}{2}y,\,y,\,\frac{3}{2}y\right)$ for every $y\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3: The system has $\left(5,2,3\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer4: The system has $\left(0,\,0,\,0\right)$ as its unique solution.

$$185, 214, 288, 424, 454, 540, 230, 490$$

Find the solution of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
&x &+ &y &+ &z &= &0 \\ 
&-x &- &y &+ &2z &= &0 \\ 
&3x &- &y &- &5z &= &0
\end{cases}$$
answer3:
The system has infinitely many solutions depending on one parameter:
$$(3+z,2-2z,z),\, \forall z\in \mathbb{R}$$.
answer4:
The system has infinitely many solutions depending on two parameter:
$$(3+z+y,y,z),\, \forall y,z\in \mathbb{R}$$.

Find the solutions of the following linear system depending on the parameters $a,b\in\mathbb{R}$:
$$\begin{cases}
3x & - & y & - & 2z & = & a \\
-x & + & 3y & - & z & = & b \\
-2x & - & 2y & + & 3z & = & 0 \\
x & - & 3y & + & z & = & 1
\end{cases}$$
answer1:
The system has no solutions if $a \neq 1$ and $b \neq -1$.
If $a=1$ and $b=-1$, then the system has $\left(\frac{2+7z}{8},\,\frac{-2+5z}{8},\,z\right)$ as solution for every $z\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3: The system has $\left(1,\,1,\,0\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer4:
The system has no solution if $a\neq 1$ and $b\neq 1$. 
If $a=b=1$, the system has $\left(1+y,\,y,\,\frac{3+y}{4}\right)$ as solution for every $y\in\mathbb{R}$.

The scalar product, $u \cdot v$, and the magnitude of $u$, $|u|$, are respectively:

Consider the differentiable function $f:\mathbb{R}^{3}\rightarrow \mathbb{R}$, $f(x,y,z)=x^{2}+3yz^{2}+xe^{yz}$ and the point $a=\left( 1,-1,1\right) .$ 

Find $\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial x}(a),\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial y}(a)$ and $\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial z}(a).$
answer1:
$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial x}(a)=2+e^{-1},\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial y}%
(a)=3+e^{-1},\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial z}(a)=-6-e^{-1}$
answer2:
$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial x}(a)=2+e^{-1},\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial y}%
(a)=3+e^{-1},\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial z}(a)=-6+e^{-1}$
answer3:
$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial x}(a)=2+e^{-1},\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial y}%
(a)=3-e^{-1},\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial z}(a)=-6-e^{-1}$
answer4:
$\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial x}(a)=2-e^{-1},\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial y}%
(a)=-3+e^{-1},\dfrac{\partial f}{\partial z}(a)=-6-e^{-1}$

question:

$$\begin{cases}
-x &+ &y &+ &z &= &0 \\
x &+ &3y &- &z &= &0
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The system has $(x,0,x)$ as solution for every $x\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3: The system has $(1,0,1)$ as unique solution.
answer4: The system has $(0,y,y)$ as solution for every $y\in\mathbb{R}$.

question:

& 4x_{1}+x_{2} \leq 14\\

represents

Four workers ($W_1$, $W_2$, $W_3$ and $W_4$) should be selected to perform three different tasks ($T_1$, $T_2$ and $T_3$), for which they are unequally prepared. Based on the qualifications and previous experience, it was possible to construct the following table which indicates, for each worker $j$, the operation time in each task  $i$ (in weeks):
	
\[
\begin{array}{l|cccc|}
& W_1 & W_2 & W_3 & W_4 \\
\hline
T_1 & 2 & 6 & 7 & 4 \\
T_2 & 9 & 8 & 4 & 2 \\

\hline

\]

f:\mathbb{R}^{2}\rightarrow\mathbb{R},\text{ }f(x,y)=x^{4}+y^{4}%
\]

Solve the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
x & + & 2y & - & 3z & + & w & = & -2 \\
3x & - & y & - & 2z & - & 4w & = & 1 \\
2x & + & 3y & - & 5z & + & w & = & -3 \\
x & + & y & - & z & + & w & = & -2
\end{cases}$$
answer2: The system has $\left(z+w,\,z-w-1,\,z,\,w\right)$ as solution for all $z,w\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3: The system has $\left(1,\,2,\,2,\,1\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer4: The system has $\left(x,\,y,\,x+y,\,x-y-1\right)$ as solution for all $x,y\in\mathbb{R}$.

answer1: The set $\{v_1, v_2, v_3\}$ is linearly dependent but $\{v_1, v_2, v_4\}$ is linearly independent.
answer2: $v_4$ is a linear combination of $v_1$ and $v_3$

question: Consider the equation $x^3+4x^2=10$. Solve the problem using the secant method considering $x_0=1.0$ and $x_1=1.5$. Which of the following sentences is true?

The conjunction of equations $\dfrac{2x-1}{3}=2-y=\dfrac{z+3}{2}$ determine a straight line $r$. 
Choose the right answer:
answer1: $r$ has the direction of $v=\bigg(\dfrac{3}{2}, -1, 2\bigg)$ and contains the point $P=\bigg(\dfrac{1}{2}, 2, -3\bigg)$.
answer2: $r$ has the direction of $v=(3, 1, 2)$ and contains the point $P=(1, 2, -3)$.
answer3: $r$ has the direction of $v=\bigg(\dfrac{3}{2}, 1, 2\bigg)$ and contains the point $P=\bigg(\dfrac{1}{2}, 2, -3\bigg)$.
answer4: $r$ has the direction of $v=(3, -1, 2)$ and contains the point $P=(1, 2, -3)$.

question: Differentiate ${y(x)= 3x^2 e^{4x}}$.

answer1: If $T:\mathbb{R}^2\longrightarrow \mathbb{R}^3$ is a linear transformation, then $T$ can be an injection.

answer3: If $T:\mathbb{R}^2\longrightarrow \mathbb{R}^3$ is a linear transformation, then $T$ can be a sobrejection.
answer4: If $T:\mathbb{R}^3\longrightarrow \mathbb{R}^3$ is a linear transformation and $ker(T)\neq \left\{(0,0,0\right\}$, then $T$ can be a sobrejection.

question: Consider the vectors of $\mathbb{R}^3$, $v_1=(2, 0, 1)$, $v_2=(1, -1, 3)$, $v_3=(1, 1, -2)$ and $v_4=(3, 1, 0)$. Choose the right answer:

x & + & 5y & - & 5z & = & 0
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The solutions of the system are $\left(\frac{5}{2}y,\,y,\,\frac{3}{2}y\right)$ for every $y\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3: The system has $\left(5,2,3\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer4: The system has $\left(0,\,0,\,0\right)$ as its unique solution.
